Meet Our New Food & Beverage Director - Official Site of Lago Mar Beach Resort & Club : Official Site of Lago Mar Beach Resort & Club 1700 South Ocean Lane, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33316 • 954.523.6511 • reservations@lagomar.com Lago Mar Logo - returns to home page Reservations Stay Gallery Specials Play Activities The Resort Shop The Spa Local Events Dine Events Meetings Meeting RFP Meeting and Conference Facilities About Blog Our Story Property Map Contact Careers Getting Here Members × Stay Gallery Play Dine Meetings Blog Our Story Members Meet Our New Food & Beverage Director May 29, 2019 6:48 pm Hi! I hope everyone had a great Memorial Day Weekend! We sure did here at Lago Mar! The weather was perfect, which attracted many of our local club members and, of course, the resort was sold out! The Promenade Bar was definitely one of our hot spots, catering to our adult guests/members celebrating the three day weekend. All ages enjoyed listening to Craig Fitch play on the Lagoon Island Saturday evening and then our steel drummer on Sunday. Our food and beverage outlets were so busy that we actually hit record numbers! Speaking of, I want to introduce our new Food and Beverage Director, Joe Nesselt, to all of you. Many of you might already know Joe, as he was the GM of Bistro Mezzaluna before he joined us. Fun fact: Joe is a native Floridian. He graduated from St. Thomas Aquinas High School and then attended St. Thomas University, where he studied Hospitality Management. He has experience in both the “back of the house” as well in the front. Back in the late ’80s, Joe managed Chuck’s Steak House and then went on to manage Macaroni Grill, where he was responsible for opening several Macaroni Grill’s around the state. We are so excited to welcome Joe to the Lago Mar Family and look forward to his new ideas coming to fruition in our different F&B outlets. Some of you already might have seen me post about our new wine glasses at the Promenade Bar. I am sure many of you appreciated the fun drink/food specials we ran for St. Patrick’s Day and Mother’s Day. Those are just a few examples of Joe’s new additions. When I asked Joe what is his favorite part of the Hospitality Business, he answered: “Every day is different!”. As I have spent my whole life in this business I can definitely attest to that. Fortunately for us, we have an amazing staff and wonderful, loyal members/guests so most days are happy! Can’t wait to find out what specials Joe has planned for all of the dads who choose to spend Father’s Day with us! Hope to see you soon! Includes: Cart, golf, range balls and prizes ($10 per person, from the entry fee, is in the gift certificate pot) Any late entrant that gains acceptance into the field will be subject to a $10 late entry fee Pairings Request - "Email onedays@fsga.org" Players can request their own groupings Send an email request for pairings to onedays@fsga.org All pairings requests must be received at least 5 days prior to the event to guarantee your pairing In the email, please specify the event and the players with whom you wish to play All other groupings are made randomly within flights Age Divisions & Approximate Yardages **All players must compete in the age division commensurate with their age as of the event day. No players are allowed to play out of their age division ** Men's Under 50 Age Division - 6,300 - 6,500 yards (Gross & Net) Men's 50-59 Age Division - 6,000 yards - 6,200 yards (Gross & Net) Men's 60-69 Age Division - 5,600 - 5,800 yards (Gross & Net) Men's 70 & Over Age Division - 5,600 - 5,800 yards (Gross & Net) Women's Division - 4,900 yards - 5,100 yards (Gross & Net) Men's Format 18 holes of net and gross stroke play within flights Each player will use their playing handicap for the day (95%) Handicap Indexes will be taken from the close of entry date Payout will be NET, then Gross. Payouts will vary based on division size. Points will be awarded based on Net scores only. Maximum score of 10 per hole is in effect Local Rule: E-5 Alternative to Stroke & Distance for Lost Ball or Ball Out of Bounds is in effect Women's Format 18 holes of net and gross stroke play Each player will use their playing handicap for the day (95%) Handicap Indexes will be taken from the close of entry date Payout will be NET, then Gross. Payouts will vary based on division size. Points will be awarded based on Net scores only. Maximum score of 10 per hole is in effect Local Rule: E-5 Alternative to Stroke & Distance for Lost Ball or Ball Out of Bounds is in effect Eligibility Men and Women amateur golfers (18 years of age or older) FSGA/GHIN handicap required for ALL players (24.0 or less for men and 34.0 or less for women) Golfers who do not have a FSGA/GHIN handicap index from a FSGA member club may purchase a handicap online at fsga.org . Live Scoring Requirements For all One-Day events, live scoring will be required through the Golf Genius mobile app. Only one person per group will need to type in the gross scores for each player, and more communication will be sent to the field a few days prior to the event. For convenience purposes, please download the Golf Genius mobile app before arriving to the course. Click here for further information regarding the One-Day events One-Day Event Information About Page Hard Card Pace of Play Code of Conduct Point Standings Host Site Lago Mar Country Club Click Here for Directions Preserving & Protecting the Game Since 1913 TOURNAMENTS MEMBERSHIP HANDICAPS CLUBS VOLUNTEER SEMINARS FOUNDATION ABOUT US Copyright © 2025 Florida State Golf Association. Increment Financing Board The Economic Development Authority (EDA) is a quasi-public, TradePort authority, whose board members are appointed by the Yellowstone County Commissioners. The EDA has 11 appointed board members. The Economic Development Corporation (EDC) is a not-for-profit corporation made up of 140-Member Investor companies. The EDC has 22 board members elected who are elected by the Member Investor companies. The boards meet together to set policy and economic development strategy for the community. The Tee Times August 2020, Vol. 13, No. 8: New ownership has energized Lago Mar Country Club. We think this is going to be the jewel of South Florida. The Tee Times - August 2020, Vol. 13, No. 8 New ownership has energized Lago Mar Country Club. We think this is going to be the jewel of South Florida. Gary Curreri 2020-07-25 04:16:20 Richard Martino had played golf at Lago Mar Country Club in Plantation numerous times. “I always thought the course was beautiful,” Martino said. “The club needed some work, but I thought it had a lot of potential. The membership is amazing and you will never thirst for a game. If you want to make friends, this is the place to be.” Martino, who has been Lago Mar general manager since December 2015, believes the club has great potential. With new ownership in place, Martino already has begun plans for capital improvements to the private country club located at 500 NW 127th Avenue. “I think it has a great opportunity to be one of the best clubs in the area,” Martino said. “The footprint … the fact that we are in a gated community. If you drive around the golf course, none of the holes are touching homes. They are all separate. “It is almost like an oasis,” he continued. “You don’t see a lot of homes; you see a lot of nature. You don’t see that in any type of club, especially one in Broward or even South Florida. The new owners have a great vision of where they want us to go and what they want us to be. Our emphasis now is to make the rest of the footprint match that experience.” Martino, who has lived in Plantation since 2000 and has been in the industry for 30 years, said the club has a happy mix of members. “The club has needed a capital infusion to make it better, improve the facilities, and improve the look,” Martino said. The club was in negotiations in the fall with the Seminole Tribe and Hard Rock to purchase the club before Mary Chris Smith and Sharon Keefe stepped in and bought it. Keefe’s father, Burke Hart, was a founding member of the club. Martino said the sale was unanimously approved by the members because this deal wouldn’t change the name, history or culture of Lago Mar. The new owners simply want to restore the Club to its original beauty, increase the amenities offered and enhance the membership experience. “Right now, we have to find the best place to invest that capital,” he said. “Where can we make the biggest impact on the member experience? Our ownership is onsite and wants to move fairly quickly, but they want to do it properly. It’s a great property and we are excited to have new owners. We think this is going to be the jewel of South Florida. “We want people to think of Lago Mar as your destination for everything, not just golf. It is a given that we have to be a great golf course and have it in pristine condition. Our focus is creating a club lifestyle for the entire family. We believe there is a need in Broward County for a true country club experience.” In 2010 Lago Mar spent $8 million for an overhaul of the existing course, overseen by noted golf architect Kipp Schulties. Lago Mar averages about 30,000 rounds each year and also has an outstanding junior program developed by Director of Golf Ernie Ruiz and Director of Instruction Emma Leonardi. Ellen Singer, director of marketing & membership, has been at the club collectively for 13 years. She lauded the pristine course conditions and said they have limited trial memberships as well as new annual memberships. Those members will enjoy weekly dinners and social events, such as ladies night out, social and competitive golf and tennis and family programming. “With the family (atmosphere) and the culture, it is exciting times at the club,” Singer said. “The social camaraderie is really great. We put a lot of events on the calendar. The west side of the county, in my opinion, hasn’t had everything as far as a pristine golf course and all of the other offerings of a private country club for the family. “We have different levels of memberships, from full golf to social. All the members are excited about the new ownership and it has created a great buzz in the community about the Club.” Call Singer at 954.445.5000 or send e-mail to ellen@lagomarcc.com for further details and to schedule a tour of the facilities. sportscom5@aol.com ©The Tee Times. Parking permits will be issued to you at time of check-in. Please have your license plate number available if needed at time of check-in. Our Security Staff will be monitoring the south entrance gate. Experience Lago Mar in All Its Dimensions Welcome To Lago Mar Beach Resort & Club The Fort Lauderdale beachfront resort that is decidedly, and purposefully, different. Understated, not loud. Gracious, not pretentious. Deferential, not presumptuous. In short, a sophisticated retreat where you can appreciate the enduring traditions of genuine hospitality. Lago Mar has recently been recognized by Condé Nast Traveler , Travel + Leisure , U.S. News & World Report, Veranda, and TripAdvisor , which named Lago Mar the No. 1 family hotel in the U.S. and No. 18 overall hotel in the U.S. Discover Transcript Of Video Ten lush acres. Largest private beach. Stately rooms and suites. All for you. Complimentary Wi-Fi No Resort Fee Free Valet and Self-Parking One car per room please. LAGO MAR BEACH RESORT & CLUB'S BLOG The Beach Life Debbie Banks Snyder represents the third generation of the Banks family who helps run Lago Mar in a marketing executive capacity. “Deb,” as she’s known to most, is a part owner of the resort who literally grew up on the hotel grounds with her brother Lee. Learn More Experience Lago Mar In every Lago Mar experience, there is one constant—your comfort and satisfaction. Stay Relax Dine Two day pre-cruise visit Can't say enough about this great place. When deciding on a hotel before the cruise I had only 2 requirements 1. on the beach 2. 2 queen beds. So happy to arrive here after a brutal Ohio winter. Received stellar customer service from everyone we came in contact with from Jerry at the front desk, to everyone in the restaurant to those we just happened to pass. Everyone was just so friendly and incredibly helpful. Was upgrated to a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds. And I cannot tell you how happy that made us and what a great first impression. Spent time out at the beach and the pools. there is so much to do on the grounds, but I was happy with the pools and beach. Beds were super comfy and bathroom had a tub, and the suite was just huge. Love the place and wish we were staying longer. Next time in Fort Lauderdale will definitely stay here again. The resort just had a nice, genuine Florida feel to it, which I adored. Very easy to get to nearby restaurants and stores by using Uber and Lyft, everything was 5 to 15 mins away. Port Everglades and airport are also not to far away making transit very easy. Highly recommend! FYI great view from the beach of ships leaving and entering the channel in/out of port. -Jules801 Perfect! This resort is perfect. Great location, great service, can't say enough. So much to offer. Loved the chance to get away from the major chains. Met some nice people that are members. Everyone is friendly. LOVE the one bedroom suite!! Love. The bathroom was amazing. Easy to take a Uber or Lyft to get into downtown nightlife area. Will definitely return and can't wait to do so. -49KS Wonderful 5 Days We stayed at Lago Mar Resort before and after our cruise out of Port Everglades.We enjoyed relaxing at the pools,and using all the great amenities.The mini-golf,shuffleboard,basketball and hammocks were all put to good use.The food at the resort is unbelievably good,and the service is 5 star.They have transportation to the cruise port and airport.The steel drum show by the pool was excellent as well.Your every request was met and exceeded.I enjoyed their private beach with palm trees and plenty of chairs and towels.The water was 78 degrees in the ocean.Will return again next year. Room Tip: All Rooms Were Great. Spring for a suite,they are sweet. -dinom Get Exclusive Offers & News › Connect With Us #MyLagoMar Our Story Reservations Amenities Gallery Blog Members Property Map Contact Us 1700 South Ocean Lane, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33316 855.209.5677 • 954.523.6511 • reservations@lagomar.com Copyright ©2025 Lago Mar Beach Resort & Club All rights reserved. Our Story - Official Site of Lago Mar Beach Resort & Club : Official Site of Lago Mar Beach Resort & Club 1700 South Ocean Lane, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33316 • 954.523.6511 • reservations@lagomar.com Lago Mar Logo - returns to home page Reservations Stay Gallery Specials Play Activities The Resort Shop The Spa Local Events Dine Events Meetings Meeting RFP Meeting and Conference Facilities About Blog Our Story Property Map Contact Careers Getting Here Members × Stay Gallery Play Dine Meetings Blog Our Story Members The Lago Mar Story Blog Our Story Property Map Sister Properties Contact The Early Years Renowned as one of the best oceanfront resorts in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Lago Mar Beach Resort & Club has been proudly owned and operated by the Banks family for 60 years. The Lago Mar Story The story begins in 1960 when Mr. Sidney Banks, a native of Bland County, Virginia, purchased the 110-room Fort Lauderdale Beach Hotel. Mr. Banks was a consummate hotelier, having worked during his boyhood in Roanoke, Virginia, hotels as a managing director of the prestigious Cavalier Beach and Cabana Club in Virginia Beach, Virginia, at the age of 31. Upon relocating to Fort Lauderdale with his wife Florence and son Walter, Mr. Banks set about creating the gracious, family-friendly atmosphere consistently rated as an American Automobile Association (AAA) Fort Lauderdale Four Diamond Resort. Mr. Banks also played an active role in the Fort Lauderdale community. He was responsible for the donation of Banks Field, the athletic grounds of Fort Lauderdale’s Pine Crest School, and in 1967 the Sales and Marketing Executives of Fort Lauderdale proclaimed him as one of the “Top Eight Businessmen of the Year.” PRESENT DAY LAGO MAR EMERGES With a beach resort in Fort Lauderdale that was like a second home to him, it’s only natural that Walter Banks, Lago Mar’s present owner and president, would follow in his father’s footsteps. The Banks family’s commitment to constant improvement resulted in the removal of the property’s outdated buildings throughout the 1980s and 1990s and their replacement with all-new structures. The South Florida luxury oceanfront resort you see today offers 204 rooms (164 suites and 40 resort rooms) plus dining, a full-service spa, and meetings and special event space on ten acres of land with 500 feet of beautiful sandy beach – one of the largest private ocean beaches in Broward County. Named “Hotelier of the Year” in 2003, Walter Banks shares the credit for Lago Mar’s success with his wife Debbie, who is responsible for directing the design and selecting the furnishings of the resort’s rooms and public space, as well as overseeing the Resort Shop and the Soda Shop. Their son Lee Banks and their daughter Debbie Banks, who make up the third generation of Lago Mar, are also personally involved in resort operations. AN AWARD-WINNING GEM OF MANY FACETS While Lago Mar is first, last and always a bastion of traditional hospitality, it offers many interpretations of that most endearing quality. It is the quintessential Fort Lauderdale beach resort. It is one of the finest private clubs in Fort Lauderdale. It is a favored destination for family beach vacations in Florida. It is an exceptional Fort Lauderdale meetings resort. Lago Mar is also a renowned location for weddings in Fort Lauderdale. Lago Mar’s list of awards is both lengthy and enviable. It was the first resort chosen in Broward County to be on the Condé Nast Gold List Edition of the “World’s Best Places to Stay.” The City of Fort Lauderdale has presented Lago Mar with two awards for “Best Architectural Design.” The Fort Lauderdale Garden Club has recognized the resort with an award for its beautiful landscaping and plant life. Lago Mar has been honored with the AAA Four Diamond Award every year since 2001. Recently named one of the top resorts in Fort Lauderdale by U.S. News & World Report, Lago Mar also ranks among the highest-rated resorts in the area on TripAdvisor.
